entry.title: Note about NYC HealthCare System
entry.content: Those mockups are both beautiful! [I have no information to add besides this]

entry.title: Email about Treasurer PDXOS Bridget Benton: Possible iPhone developer help
entry.content:
Begin forwarded message:

> From: "Bridget Benton, Treasurer PDXOS"
> Date: June 8, 2011 11:51:44 AM PDT
> To: Nick Farina
> Cc: Beth Kerschen , Shu-ju Wang
> Subject: Re: Possible iPhone developer help
>
> Hi, Nick -
>
> Beth wrote both of us about a month ago about the possibility of Spotlight Mobile working with Portland Open Studios (http://www.portlandopenstudios.com) on our iPhone app. I've been a bit crazy with other deadlines the last month, but I'd still like to talk with you about the possibilities! We're a tour of 100 artists studios in the Portland metro area occurring the 2nd and 3rd weekends of October each year. Beth is one our participating artists this year! We had a volunteer build an app for us last year that included artist information and locations that also served as the ticket to the event – the app worked, but the supervising board member had to rework some of the code.
>
> This year, we don't have that same tech expertise on the board - and we're not looking to completely rebuild the app. We are just looking to get it updated with the 2011 artists, locations, and information – I can get you the old code, and would be happy to meet with you to show you the app on my iPhone. We are an all-volunteer, not-for–profit organization and only have a budget of $200 for the app update this year, but would open to giving your oganization some free tickets to this years event for your staff as well as promotional exposure on our website and app and in next year's program (this years is already on the way to press). We can also discuss the possibility of what might be possible in an updated version so that we could build money into the 2012 budget for a more complete overhaul of the app.
>
> Let me know if you'd be interested in meeting – the work you're doing with Meridian Apps for Powells and PAM is very exciting!
>
> Warmly,
> Bridget
>
>
> --
> Bridget Benton
> Treasurer, Sales & Sponsorship Committee Chair
> Portland Open Studios
>
> cell: 503-913-4558
> email: sales@portlandopenstudios.com
> snail: PO Box 15022, Portland, OR 97293
>
> From: Beth Kerschen
> Date: Fri, 13 May 2011 10:20:01 -0700
> To: Bridget Benton
> Cc: Nick Farina
> Subject: Possible iPhone developer help
>
> Hi Bridget,
>
> This is Beth, I am one of the artists in the tour this year (I quickly said hi last Wednesday - I am friends with Kathryn Hayes). :)
>
> I am writing because I have a friend, Nick Farina, that is a fantastic smartphone developer here in Portland. He runs a company called Spotlight Mobile (www.spotlightmobile.com) and they have built a product called Meridian (www.meridian-apps.com/) that specializes in creating navigational experiences. They have done navigational apps for Powell's books store and the Portland Art Museum to name just a couple local establishments we all love.
>
> I spoke with him and they might be able to help out Portland Open Studios with a navigational map that highlights where all the artists are located with some brief information about them. Obviously you two can work out the details of what you absolutely need and what he can do to help, but I wanted to connect you two to see if we can get a Portland Open Studios App out there. I have copied Nick on this email so you can write to him directly and set something up if you still in need of help.
>
>
> Let me know if I can help in anyway as well!
>
> Thanks,
> Beth
>
>
> ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
> beth kerschen | www.bkperspectives.com
> o 503.616.2306 | c 617.462.0344 | f 815.846.0628
>
>
>
>
>
>

entry.title: Email about Gary Veum: Re: export from WCS - FM1
entry.content:
I've never seen one of these exports before so I'm not sure if it's expected. I don't have a decryption key for it or anything.

I think an easier way to proceed would be to get the IP address or hostname of the MSE server, along with a username and password for the API so we can query it for the data we need.

Would that be possible? Thanks nick

On Jun 8, 2011, at 11:41 AM, Veum, Gary wrote:

> Nick,
> Cisco indicated the xml is encrypted. Is this not what is expected?
> -gv
>
> From: Nick Farina [mailto:nick@meridianapps.com]
> Sent: Monday, June 06, 2011 5:45 PM
> To: Colby, Robert A
> Cc: Kiyo Kubo; McDermott, Jon; Veum, Gary
> Subject: Re: export from WCS - FM1
>
> Hi Rob,
>
> Kiyo has asked me to look into hooking up your MSE to Meridian.
>
> I tried opening the XML "export" file contained in the zipfile attached, but it looks garbled to me:
> http://cl.ly/7Ox1
>
> Maybe we can chat briefly about your WCS setup and the best way to proceed? My contact info is below.
>
> Thanks!
> Nick
>
> Phone: 503.998.1057
> AIM: nar1n
> Google Talk: nfarina@gmail.com
>
> On Jun 6, 2011, at 2:57 PM, Kiyo Kubo wrote:
>
>
>
> Kiyo Kubo, CEO
> Spotlight Mobile, Inc.
> m. 503.504.5759
> www.spotlightmobile.com
> Our Barnes & Noble app won one; now the American Museum of Natural History (
> Meridian v0.1)
> has been nominated for 2 more Webby's!!
> Check them all out at www.spotlightmobile.com
>
> Begin forwarded message:
>
>
> From: "Colby, Robert A"
> Date: June 6, 2011 2:45:14 PM PDT
> To: Kiyo Kubo
> Cc: "McDermott, Jon" , "Veum, Gary"
> Subject: FW: export from WCS - FM1
>
>
> Hi Kiyo,
> Attached are the WCS export files. Please keep in mind there may be confidential info so do not share.
>
> - Rob
>
> From: Veum, Gary
> Sent: Monday, June 06, 2011 2:27 PM
> To: Colby, Robert A
> Subject: export from WCS - FM1
>
>
>
>
>

entry.title: Email about Rich Cherry: Re: Event feed
entry.content:
Hi Rich and Maren,

I'm a Meridian Apps developer here at Spotlight Mobile and I was wondering
if you could answer a few questions for me.

I'm currently working on the Balboa Park Meridian App and I've been unable
to access the ical(http://www.balboapark.org/calendar/ical) or event feed (
http://bp.balboaparkonline.org/feeds/organizati...) this
morning. I was wondering what the status is on these feeds.

Also, in the email below, you suggested we use
http://www.balboapark.org/rss/organizations for Balboa organizations. This
feed, while available today, does not contain certain fields (hours,
thumbnail, image) that were in the organization feed we are currently using
and that we will be using in the Meridian App.

Thanks for your help,
Adam Kuert

On Wed, Jun 8, 2011 at 11:07 AM, Kiyo Kubo wrote:

> Here are their email addresses.
>
>
>
> Pls excuse brevity-n-typos... Sent frm iPhone.
>
> Begin forwarded message:
>
> *From:* Rich Cherry
> *Date:* June 7, 2011 11:39:10 AM PDT
> *To:* Kiyo Kubo , Maren Dougherty <
> MDougherty@bpoc.org>
> *Subject:* *RE: Event feed*
>
> We think we should make a separate feed for the Android App (it would be
> the same to start with).
>
>
>
> Here are the existing feeds:
>
>
>
>
> http://www.balboapark.org/rss/organizations
>
>
> http://www.balboapark.org/calendar/ical
>
>
>
>
>
> *From:* Kiyo Kubo [mailto:kiyo@spotlightmobile.com]
> *Sent:* Tuesday, June 07, 2011 9:39 AM
> *To:* Rich Cherry; Maren Dougherty
> *Subject:* Event feed
>
>
>
> I am trying to recall if you guys had created an xml or json feed of the
> events... did you?
>
>
>
> Kiyo
>
>
>
> Kiyo Kubo, CEO
>
> Spotlight Mobile, Inc.
>
> m. 503.504.5759
>
> www.spotlightmobile.com
>
> *Our Barnes & Noble app won one; now the American Museum of Natural
> History (*
>
> *Meridian v0.1) *
>
> *has been nominated for 2 more Webby's!! *
>
> *Check them all out at **
> www.spotlightmobile.com*
>
>
>
>

Will the real Elmhurst please stand up...please stand up. http://cl.ly/2R102L2q39011j2H1X0y .
This is the actual hospital ;) with the logo from their building and not their website. Attempted to match their space more than the website for obvious reasons using their photo gallery. Let me know what you think.

entry.title: Email about Linda Perry-Lube: couple paragraphs
entry.content:
> From: Linda Perry-Lube
> Date: June 7, 2011 3:48:48 PM PDT
> To: Kiyo Kubo
> Cc: Melissa Lefkowitz
> Subject: Fwd: couple paragraphs
>
> Can you give us a couple of paragraphs of what it would take to take the "base Explorer code and update it for another Museum's use. Thx.
>
> Linda Perry-Lube
> Chief Digital Officer/SVP
> American Museum of Natural History
>
>
> Begin forwarded message:
>
>> From: mbenedetto
>> Date: June 7, 2011 4:55:20 PM GMT-04:00
>> To: Linda Perry-Lube
>> Cc: Melissa Lefkowitz
>> Subject: Re: couple paragraphs
>>
>> Linda:
>>
>> As requested....
>>
>> Mike
>>
>> ******************************************
>>
>> The exact technical details and costs of the implementation of of an "Explorer" system at another institution would vary from site to site based on any number of preexisting conditions and constraints, but such an implementation will follow the following broad steps:
>>
>> A baseline survey of the sites radio-frequency (RF) landscape will need to be completed.
>> An appropriate wireless infrastructure that included "location aware" technologies like the Cisco Mobility Services Engine will need to be designed and installed. If the site already has some wireless infrastructure in place, this system will need to be integrated with the new system. The design and implementation of the wireless network will also need to include additional network cabling, power provisioning, network switching, and network security considerations.
>> If the institution intends on providing wireless Internet access for its visitors in addition to the "Explorer" system, this capability should be designed into the wireless infrastructure early in the design process. Should the institution go down that path, the opening of the public WiFi system should be scheduled for launch 3-6 months in advance of the "Explorer" launch to allow for a period of stress testing of the wireless network using real usage patterns by the public.
>> During the deployment of the wireless infrastructure, the RF survey will have to be continually updated as new wireless access points are brought online as the RF landscape will change with each new access point. This includes the installation of wireless access points on other floors of the building.
>> During the development of the handheld application, extensive testing with the application will need to occur to determine the correct placement of access points, power levels, channel plans, etc. . We strongly suggest that a lightweight test version of the application be developed early in the project to facilitate this testing.
>> Staff training on wireless networking and RF analysis must be undertaken to ensure that the staff is adequately trained to support the new infrastructure. This should occur as early in the process as possible.
>> While not a requirement for the implementation of an "Explorer" system, the institution considering such a deployment should use this opportunity to review the use of wireless for staff and educational purposes at an institutional level. Given that wireless networking is required for the "Explorer" system, an expansion of the wireless network for secure access by the staff can provide additional operational benefits to the institution for little or no additional cost.
>>
>> ******************************************
>>
>> On Tue, 7 Jun 2011 13:34:13 -0400, Linda Perry-Lube wrote:
>>
>>> thx.
>>> On Jun 7, 2011, at 1:17 PM, mbenedetto wrote:
>>>
>>>
>>>> No problem. I'll have a draft over to you today.
>>>>
>>>> -Mike
>>>>
>>>>
>>>> On Mon, 6 Jun 2011 18:43:55 -0400, Linda Perry-Lube wrote:
>>>>
>>>> Can you do a couple paragraph explanation of what another Museum would
>>>> have to do if they were to create an Explorer app like ours. We need
>>>> to write a 1 page paper to go with our decks form the conference for
>>>> Bloomberg. Thx.
>>>> For example:
>>>> Work with Accenture to configure wifi
>>>> Wi-Fi building
>>>> Set up the Cisco MSE
>>>> Develop a routing engine
>>>>
>>>> Linda Perry-Lube
>>>> lperry-lube@amnh.org
>>>> Sr. V.P. Chief Digital Officer
>>>> Central Park West at 79th St
>>>> New York, NY 10024
>>>> p 212.769.5091
>>>> f 212.496.3440
>>>>
>>>>
>>>>
>>>>
>>>>
>>>
>>> Linda Perry-Lube
>>> lperry-lube@amnh.org
>>> Sr. V.P. Chief Digital Officer
>>> Central Park West at 79th St
>>> New York, NY 10024
>>> p 212.769.5091
>>> f 212.496.3440
>>>
>>>
>>>
>>>
